intro: Hieracium subcaesitium, commonly known as the pale hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and roadsides. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium subcaesitium is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions and is often found in temperate climates.
